TopicTitle: I have found it!! - THE ORIGINAL KERBO LOG!

Articles.Content:
last night, i was looking over some of my and harvesters old drawings - and i found it!

nope - this ain't no april fools gag - it's the real deal!

i present, the true birthplace of the kerbal kind, the very fist documented set of (highly unsuccessful) missions -- THE ORIGINAL KERBO LOG!!

 
this was drawn by harvester himself, just over a decade ago (yeah, kerbals had been around for a while before they were put in a game) - he went by the alias 'The Shadow' back then, but you can see the similarity to the sketchwork on the KSP credits screen :thumbup:

anyways - this is also the real reason why the message 'KIA' appears on the crew monitors when they die, a lot of other subtle historical influences such as this have made it into the game as well - notice the first few recorded kerbonauts names :

again, todays date undermines my credibility - so let's have harvester vouch for this, where is he?

anyways, just thought i'd share a little of bit of recently rediscovered kerbal history

:cheers:

Edited May 5, 2017 by Moach
reuploaded image

Awesome!!!

The history KSP right here, folks!

That looks very nostalgic.

Or at least for me, i drew a lot earlier on.
Time for some KSP history class?

Awesome!

Still can\'t believe this isn\'t April Fool\'s.

EDIT:So over a decade and now they\'re (Moach and Harv) 27 which is only around 14-16.

...

Amazing.
I like IX, 'Almost not enough thrust.' Just like so many of my rockets. 'Just one more booster.....'
Who knows what evil lurks in the hearts of Kerbals... THE SHADOW KNOWS!
This is the work of God!

Wow, I\'m amazed that still existed!

That\'s no April fool\'s gag there, it\'s the real deal.

I had completely forgotten about that 'log' though. I guess those ideas were stored in a pretty deep place in my brain.

And yeah it was just over 10 years ago. We were 17 at the time. Lots of free time

Awesome find there!!

Cheers

I need to strap a rocket engine on a model airplane now.

*Goes off to modify existing Mosquito Mk. VI*
Very cool! I really love that line-sketch style that can also e found in the credits.

The Shadow? THE SHADOW!?

(nerd points to whoever recognizes the reference)
Love the names of the kermans. Its great to see how it came into being. Thanks moach for putting it up.
I\'m going to log my missions on paper in a similar style from now on. Love it. Were these home-made rockets?

The Shadow? THE SHADOW!?

(nerd points to whoever recognizes the reference)

If you go to the Mun, you will die!

I\'m going to log my missions on paper in a similar style from now on. Love it. Were these home-made rockets?

Yep (or at least thats how the story goes).
Heh, on my bookshelf I have a logbook and little box of recovered/burnt out rocket \'shells\' from back when I used to make heaps of little rockets and launch them. Good times ;D

those were dangerously home-made rockets.... seriously, you know how kerbals die in horrible fiery violence aboard those things? - yeah, now you definitely wouldn\'t want that happening in your hand, right?

now, i think it goes without saying, but never hurts to insist, so repeat after me:

I WILL NOT TRY THIS AT HOME

you\'ve been warned :thumbup:

Because of this thread I\'ve tried to create a small rocket from a bottle and an airpump.

The idea was for the airpump to pump air into the bottle until the bottle shot into the air.

It ended with me braking the air-pump D:

Try pouring some water in the bottle. The results can be quite spectacular.

Or if you\'re insane, gasoline and then put an open flame under the launchpad.

now, i think it goes without saying, but never hurts to insist, so repeat after me:

I WILL NOT TRY THIS AT HOME

I WILL TRY THIS AT HOME.
The Shadow, reminds me of the good ol days of KSP when if you went into the dark side of kerbin you would die =P
This needs to go into a in game museum.
Sorry, I had to resurrect this thread, it's just too damn awesome to ignore.
